thread.title: Cloud storage firm Box reports 20 pct rise in qtrly revenue

title: Cloud storage firm Box reports 20 pct rise in qtrly revenue
text:
May 30, 2018 / 8:08 PM / a few seconds ago Cloud storage firm Box's revenue edges past estimates Reuters Staff 2 Min Read
(Reuters) - Cloud storage provider Box Inc ( BOX.N ) reported first-quarter revenue that edged past Wall Street estimates as it ramped up spending to add more paying customers.
The company signed 85,000 paying customers in the first quarter, up from 82,000 in the fourth quarter, but also spent 9 percent more from last year on marketing to attract them.
The company’s shares, which have risen nearly 45 percent in the last 12 months, fell 2.8 percent in extended trading.
Box forecast second-quarter revenue at between $146 million and $147 million and an adjusted loss of 6 cents to 5 cents per share.
Analysts on average were expecting revenue of $146.1 million and a loss of 7 cents per share, according to Thomson Reuters I/B/E/S.
Box competes with Dropbox Inc ( DBX.O ), Microsoft Corp’s ( MSFT.O ) OneDrive and Google’s Drive.
Redwood City, California-based Box said its revenue rose 20 percent to $140.5 million in the quarter ended April 30.
Net loss attributable to shareholders narrowed to $36.6 million, or 26 cents per share, from $40.1 million, or 30 cents per share.
Excluding items, the company lost 7 cents per share.
Analysts had expected revenue of $139.71 million and a loss of 8 cents per share. Reporting by Arjun Panchadar in Bengaluru; Editing by Maju Samuel
